{{small|{{Nastaliq|راجہ پرویز اشرف }}}} |image = |order = [[List of Prime Ministers of Pakistan|19th]] |office = Prime Minister of Pakistan |president = [[Asif Ali Zardari]] |deputy = [[Chaudhry Pervaiz Elahi]] |term_start = 22 June 2012 |term_end = 24 March 2013 |predecessor = [[Yousaf Raza Gillani]] |successor = [[Mir Hazar Khan Khoso]] |office1 = [[Minister for Water and Power (Pakistan)|Minister for Water and Power]] |primeminister1 = [[Yousaf Raza Gillani]] |term_start1 = 31 March 2008 |term_end1 = 9 February 2011 |predecessor1 = [[Liaquat Ali Jatoi]] |successor1 = [[Syed Naveed Qamar]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1950|12|26|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Sanghar]], [[Sind Province (1936-55)|Sind]], [[Pakistan]]
|death_date = |death_place = |party = [[Pakistan Peoples Party]] |alma_mater = [[University of Sindh]] |spouse = Nusrat Pervaiz Ashraf |children = 4 |occupation = [[Agriculturist]], [[Business]] |religion = [[Islam]] |website = }} '''Raja Pervaiz Ashraf''' ({{lang-ur|{{Nastaliq|راجہ پرویز اشرف}}}}; born 26 December 1950), is a [[businessman]], [[agriculturist]], and [[politician]] who served as 19th [[Prime Minister of Pakistan]] from 22 June 2012 until completing his designated term on 16 March 2013.{{cite news|title=Raja Pervez Ashraf declared new Pakistani PM|url=http://dawn.com/2012/06/22/parliament-begins-new-pm-election/|accessdate=22 June 2012|newspaper=[[Dawn (newspaper)|DAWN]] |date=22 June 2012}}{{cite web |url=http://www.pmo.gov.pk/former_pms.php|title=FORMER PRIME MINISTERS |publisher=pmo.gov.pk}} He currently resides in Sanghar House,[[ Gujar Khan Tehsil|Gujar Khan]]. Prior to be elevated as Prime minister, he previously served as the [[Minister for Water and Power (Pakistan)|Minister for Water and Power]] in the [[Yousaf Raza Gillani]]-led government from March 2008 to February 2011.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2008\04\01\story_1-4-2008_pg1_5 |title=24-member federal cabinet takes oath|newspaper=[[Daily Times (Pakistan)|Daily Times]]| first=Sajjad|last=Malik|accessdate=1 April 2008}} A senior-ranking leader in the [[Pakistan Peoples Party]] (PPP) from [[Rawalpindi District]], Ashraf assumed premiership on 22 June 2012 after Yousaf Raza Gillani was disqualified over [[contempt of court]] charges. Shortlisted by the PPP as a candidate for the post, he was eventually elected based on a 211–89 vote in the National Assembly. Tackling the corruption scandals, one of the major achievements during his premiership was his interest to develop and implement hydro projects in particular Neelum-Jhelum project of 970 MW. The project had received a big jolt when the Chinese Exim Bank refused to release $448 million loan linking it to the restoration of the Safe City Project in Islamabad which has been stopped by the Supreme Court of Pakistan.{{cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-13-20043-Rs24-bn-diverted-to-Neelum-Jhelum-project |title=Rs24 bn diverted to Neelum-Jhelum project|work=[[The News International]]|date=6 January 2013|accessdate=7 January 2013}} During his tenure [[Water and Power Development Authority]] (WAPDA) had launched a number of mega and medium-sized projects in [[Gilgit–Baltistan]].{{cite news|url=http://pakobserver.net/detailnews.asp?id=198920 |title=PPP govt pursuing multi-pronged strategy for GB development|work=[[Pakistan Observer]]|date=6 March 2013|accessdate=7 March 2013}} ==Personal life and childhood== Raja Pervaiz Ashraf was born on 26 December 1950 in [[Sanghar]], interior [[Sindh]]. He graduated from the [[University of Sindh]] in 1970 and was involved in agriculture before entering politics.{{cite news| url=http://dawn.com/2012/06/22/profile-raja-pervaiz-ashraf/|title=Profile: Raja Pervaiz Ashraf|newspaper=[[Dawn (newspaper)|DAWN]]|accessdate=23 June 2012}} He is married to Nusrat Pervaiz Ashraf{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/437401/celebrating-culture-theres-no-shame-in-wearing-a-hijab/|title=There’s no shame in wearing a hijab|work=[[The Express Tribune]]|date=16 September 2012|accessdate=18 September 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2012%5C09%5C16%5Cstory_16-9-2012_pg7_11|title=First lady urges women to wear hijab|work=[[Daily Times (Pakistan)]]|date=16 September 2012|accessdate=18 September 2012}} and has four children, which include two sons and two daughters. Ashraf belongs to the [[Minhas]] clan of Pakhral and is originally from [[Gujar Khan]], an industrial town in the [[Rawalpindi District]] of the [[Pothohar Plateau|Potohar region]] in northern [[Punjab, Pakistan|Punjab]].{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-06-22/pakistan/32368519_1_power-project-energy-minister-sindh|title=Who is Raja Pervez Ashraf?|work=The Times of India|date=22 June 2012|accessdate=5 July 2012}} The Potohar region is home to numerous prominent political and military personalities.{{cite web|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-2-116171-Barren-Potohar-the-cradle-of-leaders-good-and-bad|title=Barren Potohar, the cradle of leaders, good and bad|work=The News}}{{cite web|author=Anita Joshua|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/international/article3559911.ece|title=Manmohan, new Pak PM from same region|work=The Hindu}} Ashraf comes from a middle class [[Potwari language|Potohari-speaking]] family of landowners who have had a traditional background in politics. An uncle of his served as a minister in the cabinet of [[Ayub Khan (Field Marshal)|Ayub Khan]] during the 1960s.{{cite web|url=http://dawn.com/2012/06/22/with-ashrafs-nomination-potoharis-secure-key-posts-in-country/|title=With Ashraf’s nomination, Potoharis secure key posts in country|work=Dawn|date=22 June 2012|accessdate=29 December 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://dawn.com/2012/06/23/illustrious-sons-of-potohar-2/|title=Illustrious sons of Potohar|work=Dawn|date=4 May 2012}} His parents owned agricultural land in the town of Sanghar in [[Sindh]], where he was Born and brought up.[http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2012%5C06%5C23%5Cstory_23-6-2012_pg7_22 Raja Pervez Ashraf: the new leader], Daily Times. Ashraf is [[Multilingualism|multilingual]] and can fluently speak [[English language|English]], [[Urdu language|Urdu]], [[Punjabi language|Punjabi]] and [[Pothohari dialect|Potwari]] and [[Sindhi language|Sindhi]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-18552145|title=Profile: Raja Pervez Ashraf|publisher=BBC News|date=22 June 2012|accessdate=11 July 2012}} ==Political career== He is regarded as an important PPP loyalist and leader in the Rawalpindi region. He contested parliamentary elections in 1990, 1993 and 1997. He won in elections held in 2002 and then in 2008, following which he was appointed as federal minister for water, and as power minister in the cabinet of Prime Minister Yousaf Raza Gillani. [[File:PPP-Hoarding.JPG|thumbnail|Raja Ashraf on a hoarding]] ===Member of Parliament=== Ashraf has been twice elected Member of the [[National Assembly of Pakistan]] (MNA) from his constituency of [[Gujar Khan]], Rawalpindi District. He won re-election in the [[Pakistani general election, 2008|February 2008 elections]]. During his time as an MNA, he served as a member of the Standing Committee on Kashmir and the Standing Committee on Law, Justice and Human Rights. Before his ascendance to the post of prime minister, he was also the secretary general of the PPP.{{cite web|url=http://www.infopak.gov.pk/primeminister.aspx|title=Raja Pervez Ashraf|work=[[Ministry of Information and Broadcasting (Pakistan)]]|accessdate=5 June 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120616033558/http://www.infopak.gov.pk/primeminister.aspx|archivedate=16 June 2012|df=dmy-all}} ===Water and Power ministry=== He became the head of the [[Ministry of Water and Power (Pakistan)|Water and Power Ministry]] in the coalition government of [[Pakistan Peoples Party|PPP]], [[Pakistan Muslim League (N)|PML-N]], [[Awami National Party|ANP]], [[Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam|JUI-F]] and [[Muttahida Qaumi Movement|MQM]] formed after the 2008 elections.{{cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/2008/03/29/top1.htm|title=Parties finally clinch deal on key ministries|first=Amir|last=Wasim|newspaper=DAWN|accessdate=29 March 2008}} During his tenure as power minister, there was a chronic shortage of electricity generation throughout the country and power cuts ([[load shedding]]) remained frequent. In the position, he faced heavy criticism for repeatedly promising the country's power crisis would be over "by 2008" as the country suffered regular blackouts. He became one of the most sought after ministers in the National Assembly, by legislators who demanded answers for the power crisis.{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/398379/as-water-and-power-czar-ashraf-was-the-most-sought-after-minister-in-na/|title= As water and power czar, Ashraf was the most sought after minister in NA|work=The Express Tribune|date=24 June 2012|accessdate=11 July 2012}} According to a report on his parliamentary performance, the water and power ministry while Ashraf was in-charge received as many as 1,147 official questions and queries, of which only 60% were responded to. The report opined that Ashraf's performance as minister was "tainted by failures to overcome the power shortfall that continued to aggravate even after he was replaced" and that his actions and responses both inside and outside the National Assembly had "not been translated into actions" Nevertheless, about 3,570 megawatts of power was added to the national grid during the PPP government, a major portion of which came during Ashraf's term in office. His term is said to have overseen relatively more megawatts being added to the national grid when compared to other ministers of power and energy since [[Benazir Bhutto]]'s last government. He was accused of receiving kickbacks in the rental power projects, and of using illegal money to buy foreign property. Ashraf denied the charges, and as of June 2012, was defending himself before the [[Supreme Court of Pakistan|Supreme Court]]. No official charges have been framed against him as no evidence could be presented so far. One of the main reasons for power crisis, which have never received due attention and focus is the circular debt and which continued to increase over the years. The government has time and again tried to clear the circular debt, however it comes again. This is because of the structural issues including power theft, poor recovery from other government departments, difference between cost of generation and actual cost charged to customer.{{cite news|url=: [https://www.economist.com/blogs/banyan/2012/05/pakistan’s-energy-crisis] |title=Pakistan’s energy crisis Power politics|work=[[The Economist]]|date=21 May 2012|accessdate=22 May 2012}} During Ashraf`s government prioritised hydro power projects in particular Neelum Jhelum 970 MW. During his term, WAPDA initiated several hydro projects in Gilgit Baltistan (GB) including the Satpara Dam having 17 MW power generation capacity and 0.093 million acre feetwater storage capacity and Diamer-Bhasha Dam having 4,500 MW power generation capacity and 8.1 million acre feet water storage capacity, along with hydropower projects of 7,100 MW Bunji, 34 MW Harpo, 80 MW Phandar and 40 MW Basho. Hydro power is the cheapest energy source and as Minister and PM he gave special attention, however hydro power projects take long time to complete and the electricity from the projects will be available after 10 years. In order to resolve short term energy crisis, Ashraf implemented power project on rental basis, following the rental policy approved in Mushrrafs tenure. However the projects became controversial. ==Prime Minister of Pakistan== ===Early days=== On 26 April 2012, Prime Minister [[Yousaf Raza Gillani]] was convicted of being in contempt of court for refusing to bring charges against President [[Asif Ali Zardari]]. On 19 June 2012, Gillani was retroactively ruled ineligible to hold the office by the Supreme Court. The ruling [[Pakistan People's Party]] nominated textile minister [[Makhdoom Shahabuddin]] to replace Gillani, but the nomination failed when the [[Anti-Narcotics Force]] issued a warrant for Shahabuddin's arrest on drug charges. Ashraf was then selected as the party's next option. On 22 June 2012, Raja Pervez Ashraf was elected [[Prime Minister of Pakistan|Prime Minister]] of [[Pakistan]] by a 211–89 vote.{{cite news| url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/pakistan/Raja-Pervez-Ashraf-elected-new-PM-of-Pakistan/articleshow/14342856.cms| title=Raja Pervez Ashraf elected new PM of Pakistan| newspaper=[[The Times of India]]| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120622181805/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/pakistan/Raja-Pervez-Ashraf-elected-new-PM-of-Pakistan/articleshow/14342856.cms| archivedate=22 June 2012| df=dmy-all}} Ashraf and his cabinet were sworn in on the same day.{{cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/article-55575-Raja-Parvaiz-Ashraf-and-federal-cabinet-to-take-oath-tonight|newspaper=[[The News International]]|title=Raja Pervaiz to be sworn in tonight| date=22 June 2012}} His selection as Prime Minister restored the country's government after several days of turmoil where officially the country was without a government.{{cite news|title=Raja Pervaiz Ashraf Is Pakistan's New Prime Minister|author=Rebecca Santana|author2=Chris Brummitt|author3=Zarar Khan|date=22 June 2012|agency=Associated Press|work=Huffington Post|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/06/22/raja-pervaiz-ashraf-pakistan-prime-minister_n_1618675.html|accessdate=23 June 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120803061417/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/06/22/raja-pervaiz-ashraf-pakistan-prime-minister_n_1618675.html|archivedate=3 August 2012|df=dmy-all}} The [[Associated Press]] said Ashraf's election was "unlikely to calm the tensions roiling the country" and noted that many observers expected him be eventually be ousted like his predecessor. Political analyst Raza Rumi said Ashraf was likely chosen by the PPP because they knew he would not last long. On 24 July 2012, the Government informed the Supreme Court, one day before expiry of the court's deadline, that it has not taken a decision on reopening of the graft cases against President Zardari.{{cite news| url= http://www.indianexpress.com/news/after-gilani-ashraf-defies-pak-sc-order-to-reopen-case-against-zardari/978742/0|title= After Gilani, Ashraf defies Pak SC order to reopen case against Zardari|date= 24 July 2012}} ===Socioeconomic challenges=== Immediately after his election, Ashraf said that the economy, inflation, and the country's power crisis would be his top concerns. "Our country cannot afford politics of confrontation at this time," he said. Within 24 hours of being elected, Ashraf held a meeting to resolve the energy crisis in the country and directed the Ministry of Petroleum to ensure the supply of 28,000 tonnes of fuel daily to power plants, so as to add 1200 mega watts to the national grid system.{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/398102/first-task-prime-minister-ashraf-calls-conference-on-energy-crisis/|title=Ensure 28000 tonnes per day fuel to power plants: Ashraf|work=The Express Tribune|date=23 June 2012|accessdate=24 June 2012}} There were power protests erupting throughout the country for continual load shedding.{{cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-7-118582-Power-protesters-block-roads-as-PM-visits-Peshawar|title=Power protesters block roads as PM visits Peshawar|work=The News|date=5 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} The [[Pakistan Economy Watch]] (PEW) was critical of this renewed focus on energy, calling it a "useless effort" with the president of PEW, Murtaza Mughal, remarking that load shedding had only "increased in the harrowing summer", making life difficult for the ordinary citizen; Mughal further noted that the announcement of adding more fuel into independent power producers had been portrayed positively, despite the fact that the actual problem did not lie in scarcity of fuel but rather in non-payment of dues.{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/403718/energy-woes-pms-efforts-unproductive-says-pew/|title=Energy woes: PM’s efforts unproductive, says PEW|work=The Express Tribune|date=5 July 2012|accessdate=5 July 2012}} Businesspeople and economists in Pakistan had a mixed response to Ashraf's appointment; while some appreciated the prime minister's focus on the energy crisis and hoped for greater cooperation between key institutions and political parties as being good for economic stability, others questioned his reputation related to rental power and expressed anxiety over the government's ongoing clash with the judiciary which could cause uncertainty and scare businesses away. A government official praised the smooth transition of power and said that the country's economic policy would stay the same, adding that the government's economic team will carry on with implementing the [[2012 Pakistan federal budget|budget]] and other economic functions as present before Gillani's disqualification.{{cite news|url=http://www.gulf-times.com/site/topics/article.asp?cu_no=2&item_no=516508&version=1&template_id=41&parent_id=23|title=Business community expects no wonders from PM Raja|work=[[Gulf Times]]|date=3 July 2012|accessdate=5 July 2012}} As an initiative to overcome the energy crises, Ashraf announced his intention to build several small dams across the country. He said that these projects would start from his native Potohar plateau, as part of a development programme for the Potohar region.{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/405258/pm-ashraf-wants-small-dams-to-meet-power-needs/|title=PM Ashraf wants small dams to meet power needs|work=The Express Tribune|date=8 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} Apart from energy, he identified the deteriorating law and order situation of Karachi, especially with regards to [[Target killings in Karachi|target killings]], as a second major challenge.{{cite news|url=http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2012/06/26/news/national/energy-karachi-security-major-challenges-pm/|title=Energy, Karachi security major challenges: PM|work=[[Pakistan Today]]|date=26 June 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} In September 2012, during his maiden trip to [[Gilgit-Baltistan]], Ashraf announced a [[Pakistani rupee|Rs.]] 2 billion development package for the region.{{cite web|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/444249/pm-announces-rs2b-package-for-g-b/|title=PM announces Rs2b package for G-B|date=29 September 2012|work=The Express Tribune|accessdate=31 January 2016}} On 12 July 2012, The Supreme Court in its NRO implementation case order has ruled that Prime Minister Raja Pervaiz Ashraf must write the letter to Swiss authorities to reopen graft cases against President Asif Ali Zardari.{{cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/article-58528-SC-orders-PM-Ashraf-to-write-letter-|title=SC orders PM Ashraf to write letter|work=The News International|date=12 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} On 25 July 2012, The Supreme Court gave Raja Pervaiz Ashraf to 8 August 2012 to implement its order by writing a letter to Swiss authorities to reopen graft cases against President Asif Ali Zradari.{{cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/article-60410-NRO-Implementation:-SC-orders-PM-Ashraf-to-write-letter-by-August-8|title=NRO: PM ordered to write letter by Aug 8|work=The News International|date=25 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} On 8 August 2012, the supreme court adjourned the hearing till 18 September 2012 ===Political developments=== Three days after his election, Ashraf visited [[Nine Zero]] and met with leaders of the [[Muttahida Qaumi Movement]] in Karachi. He also visited the leader of the [[Pakistan Muslim League (F)]]. The visits were seen as part of a fresh move to reaffirm ties with coalition political parties.{{cite news|url=http://dawn.com/2012/06/25/pm-ashraf-visits-nine-zero-kingri-house-during-karachi-visit/|title=PM Ashraf visits Nine Zero, Kingri House during Karachi visit|work=Dawn|date=25 June 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} The first significant milestone Ashraf performed after taking charge of his office was an approval for the creation of a post of [[Deputy Prime Minister of Pakistan]] to fulfill a demand of the coalition party [[Pakistan Muslim League (Q)]] (PML-Q). The post was inaugurated on 25 June and [[Chaudhry Pervez Elahi]] of PML-Q was appointed as the first deputy prime minister of the country.{{cite news|url=http://dawn.com/2012/06/25/demands-fulfilled-15-ministries-granted-to-pml-q/|title=PML-Q’s demands fulfilled; Elahi made Deputy PM, 15 ministries granted|work=Dawn|date=25 June 2012|accessdate=26 June 2012}} However, the position is largely symbolic and has no legal constitutional duties. On 27 June 2012, the [[Supreme Court of Pakistan]] gave prime minister Ashraf two weeks to indicate whether he would ask Swiss authorities to reopen [[corruption]] cases against president Zardari.{{cite news|url=http://pakobserver.net/detailnews.asp?id=162193|title=SC wants Swiss letter by PM in two weeks|work=[[Pak Observer]]|date=28 June 2012|accessdate=15 January 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Ayl4EWFi?url=http://pakobserver.net/detailnews.asp?id=162193|archivedate=27 September 2012|df=dmy-all}} However, Ashraf stated that his position on the issue was no different from that of previous prime minister Gillani.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2012%5C06%5C27%5Cstory_27-6-2012_pg7_2|title=Petition filed against new PM over Swiss letter|work=Daily Times|date=27 June 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} In the first week of July, he directed attention on the [[Balochistan conflict]] and called for a high-level meeting to discuss the issue of [[Missing persons (Pakistan)|missing persons]] in the province.{{cite news|url=http://dunyanews.tv/index.php?key=Q2F0SUQ9MiNOaWQ9ODgwNDU=|title=High-level meeting on missing persons’ issue today|work=Dunya News|date=3 July 2012|accessdate=5 July 2012}} In the first week of July, Ashraf announced the government's plans to establish legislation which would remove the bar on dual nationality holders from contesting in elections. If passed, the legislation would enable [[Overseas Pakistanis]] holding dual nationalities eligible to participate in elections and hold public office. The enforcement of such a legislation remains a controversial issue.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2012%5C07%5C02%5Cstory_2-7-2012_pg1_3|title=Govt will bring law to allow dual nationals contest elections: PM|work=Daily Times|date=2 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} He made a visit to [[Peshawar]] a few days later, where he met local politicians, during which he expressed his views on the parliament being "the mother of all institutions".{{cite news|url=http://www.nation.com.pk/pakistan-news-newspaper-daily-english-online/national/05-Jul-2012/parliament-is-the-mother-of-all-institutions-pm|title=Parliament is the mother of all institutions: PM|work=The Nation|date=5 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} He has praised the role of [[Democracy in Pakistan|democracy]] in creating an "independent media, judiciary and parliament." He further paid tribute to the [[Pakistan Army]] in its [[Pakistan's role in the War on Terror|role in the War on Terror]] and military operations in the troubled northwestern areas.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2012%5C07%5C11%5Cstory_11-7-2012_pg7_16|title=Independent media, judiciary, parliament fruits of democracy: PM|date=11 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} In the fraud case against [[Asif Ali Zardari]], he indicated in September 2012 that he would be willing to open the pending fraud cases.{{cite news|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/asia/2012/09/20129181154102792.html|title=Pakistan to 'reopen Zardari fraud cases' – Central & South Asia|publisher=Al Jazeera|date=18 September 2012|accessdate=15 January 2013}} ===Foreign policy=== When commenting on [[Foreign relations of Pakistan|foreign policy]] after assuming premiership, Ashraf said that he wanted to deal with the [[United States]] on "an equal footing". However, he will likely have to deal with the court's demands to charge Zardari before doing much else. [[Prime Minister of India|Prime Minister]] [[Manmohan Singh]] of [[India]] congratulated Ashraf shortly after his election, and anticipated greater progress in bilateral [[India–Pakistan relations|relations between the two countries]] during Ashraf's term.{{cite web|url=http://pmindia.nic.in/press-details.php?nodeid=1453|title=PM congratulates Prime Minister Raja Pervez Ashraf|work=[[Prime Minister's Office (India)]]|date=22 June 2012|accessdate=5 July 2012}} The Chinese government greeted Ashraf and pledged [[China–Pakistan relations|closer ties with Pakistan]] to strengthen their "all-weather friendship".{{cite news|url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2012-06-25/news/32409313_1_yousuf-raza-gilani-ministry-spokesman-hong-lei-friendly-neighbour|title=China greets new Pakistan PM Raja Pervez Ashraf; pledges close partnership|work=The Economic Times|date=25 June 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} Other notable messages of congratulation came from U.S. Secretary of State [[Hillary Clinton]] and Afghan president [[Hamid Karzai]].{{cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/article-56909-Clinton-hopes-relations-will-improve-during-PM-Raja-Pervaiz's-tenure|title=Hillary Clinton calls PM Raja Pervaiz|work=Dawn|date=1 June 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://president.gov.af/en/news/10794|title=President Karzai Congratulates Pakistan’s New Prime Minister|work=Office of the President of Afghanistan|date=23 June 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} On 24 June 2012, several [[Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan|Tehrik-i-Taliban]] militants from Afghanistan entered Pakistan's [[Durand Line|bordering]] [[FATA|tribal areas]] killing 13 Pakistani troops, of which seven were beheaded. During the conflict, Pakistani troops killed fourteen of the raiding militants. The attack, one of several such [[Afghanistan–Pakistan skirmishes|cross-border skirmishes]], was strongly condemned with Raja Pervaiz Ashraf stating that the matter would be directly taken to Afghan president Hamid Karzai.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jun/26/militants-behead-pakistani-troops-afghanistan|title=Militants 'behead Pakistani troops after crossing border from Afghanistan'|work=The Guardian|date=26 June 2012|accessdate=11 June 2012}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/06/26/world/asia/taliban-kill-13-soldiers-in-pakistan-raid.html|title=Taliban Kill 13 Soldiers in Pakistan Raid|work=The New York Times|date=25 June 2012|accessdate=11 June 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/410064/cross-border-attacks-high-on-agenda-for-ashrafs-afghanistan-tour/|title=Cross-border attacks high on agenda for Ashraf's Afghanistan tour|work=The Express Tribune|date=18 July 2012|accessdate=19 July 2012}} Regarding his stand on the [[Kashmir conflict]] with India, Ashraf has categorically stated that Pakistan would continue providing moral, political, and diplomatic support to the [[Kashmiri people]] of [[Jammu and Kashmir]] until a solution was to be reached for the issue in accordance with UN resolutions and Kashmiri aspirations.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-07-06/pakistan/32565564_1_kashmir-issue-indian-counterpart-ranjan-mathai-india-and-pakistan|title=Pakistan to continue support to Kashmir cause: PM Raja Pervez Ashraf|work=The Times of India|date=6 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/410381/pm-ashraf-calls-for-resolving-tensions-with-india/|title=PM Ashraf calls for resolving tensions with India|work=The Express Tribune|date=19 July 2012|accessdate=19 July 2012|first=A. H.|last=Nizami}} Ashraf is expected to visit [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]], to hold talks with the Afghan leadership on the peace process in Afghanistan amidst the ongoing Afghan war and to discuss the status of Afghan-led reconciliation with the [[Afghan Taliban]]. The visit comes at a time when Pakistan's relations with the United States have improved in the aftermath of the 2011 NATO attack.{{cite news|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/406063/pm-ashraf-to-visit-kabul-to-expedite-peace-efforts/|title=PM Ashraf to visit Kabul to expedite peace efforts|work=The Express Tribune|date=10 July 2012|accessdate=12 July 2012}} On 15 July, he performed a two-day state visit to [[Saudi Arabia]], his first official tour since becoming prime minister. During the visit, he would perform [[Umrah]], meet with King [[Abdullah of Saudi Arabia]], discuss the status of [[Pakistan-Saudi Arabia relations|relations between Pakistan and Saudi Arabia]] and also meet members of the [[Pakistanis in Saudi Arabia|Pakistani community in Saudi Arabia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.geo.tv/GeoDetail.aspx?ID=58966|title=GeoTV Geo News Latest News Breaking News Pakistan Live Videos|work=geo.tv|accessdate=31 January 2016}} On his visit to [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]], in late July 2012, Ashraf met with Karzai government officials and engaged in talks with the two main opposition leaders [[Abdullah Abdullah]] from the [[National Coalition of Afghanistan]] and [[Ahmad Zia Massoud]] from the [[National Front of Afghanistan]]. Among other things they discussed the need for increased and regular dialogue between leaders of Afghanistan and Pakistan.[http://www.etelaf-melli.com/contents.php?lang=fa§ion=interviews&id=591 Ashraf in Kabul] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130122154401/http://www.etelaf-melli.com/contents.php?lang=fa§ion=interviews&id=591 |date=22 January 2013 }} On 30 March, the apex court had directed the National Accountability Bureau to proceed against those who were in the post of minister for water and power from 2006 till the next general elections. As a result, on 20 April, NAB issued arrest warrants for 33 persons, including Ashraf.{{cite news|url=http://www.thenewstribe.com/2013/01/15/supreme-court-orders-to-arrest-prime-minister-raja-pervez-ashraf/ |title=Rental power case: Supreme Court orders to arrest Prime Minister Raja Pervez Ashraf |publisher=The News Tribe |accessdate=2013-01-15}} ==Controversies== ===Arrest order=== On 15 January 2013, the [[Supreme Court of Pakistan]] ordered the arrest of Raja Pervaiz Ashraf for alleged [[Political corruption|corruption]] as Ashraf was accused of [[kickbacks]] from rental [[Power station|power plants]] that were part of a project intended to serve as part of the solution to Pakistan's power problems.{{cite web|last=Rodriguez|first=Alex|title=Pakistani Prime Minister Raja Pervez Ashraf ordered arrested|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2013/jan/15/world/la-fg-pakistan-corruption-20130116|work=Los Angeles Times|accessdate=17 January 2013}} The media derided Raja Pervaiz Ashraf as ''Rental Raja''.[http://www.awaztoday.com/News-Talk-Shows/24470/Raja-Pervaiz-Ashraf-Raja-Rental-History.aspx Raja Pervaiz Ashraf ‘Raja Rental’ History] The arrest order came at the same time as the [[Long March (Pakistan)|Long March]] culminated in the national capital of [[Islamabad]]. None of the accused in the rental case has been convicted so far. The rental power case is pending with independent Supreme court for nearly four years and no conviction has been made. Ashraf has time and again demanded clearance of his name and denies all the charges. Ashraf in his appearance in the Supreme Court categorically denied such charges and offered his complete cooperation with all authorities and courts. A member of the ruling [[Pakistan People's Party]] referred to the arrest order as "a conspiracy" while Pakistan's interior minister [[Rehman Malik]], claimed that "Even after this order, (Ashraf) is the prime minister and, God willing, he will continue as prime minister."{{cite web|last=Habib|first=Nasir|title=Pakistani Supreme Court orders arrest of prime minister in corruption case|url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/01/15/world/asia/pakistan-politics/index.html|publisher=CNN|accessdate=17 January 2013|author2=Jethro Mullen }} The [[National Accountability Bureau|accountability court]] in Islamabad [[Indictment|indicted]] former [[Prime Minister of Pakistan|Prime Minister]] Raja Pervez Ashraf and six others in the rental power case on 16 January 2014.{{cite {{Infobox person | name = Rudy Provoost | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1959|10|16|df=y}} | birth_place = Belgium | death_date = | death_place = | education = [[Vlerick Leuven Gent Management School|Vlerick Business School]] | occupation = {{ubl|Businessman and entrepreneur}} | spouse = }} '''Rudy Provoost''' (born 16 October 1959) is a Belgian businessman and entrepreneur.
== Education == Provoost holds a Master's degree in Psychology from [[Ghent University]] (1982), and a Master's degree in Business Management from the [[Vlerick Leuven Gent Management School|Vlerick Business School]] (1983) in Belgium.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/rudy-provoost/|title=Forbes – Rudy provoost' |publisher= forbes.com |date=|accessdate=2013-11-03}}</ref>
== Professional career ==
===Early career=== Provoost started his career at [[Procter & Gamble]] in 1984, before moving to [[Canon Inc.|Canon]] in 1987.
In 1992, he joined [[Whirlpool Corporation]] as Managing Director for Belgium and was later promoted to Vice-President, Consumer Services for Europe (based in Germany).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=8201779&ticker=PHG:AU|title=Business Week – Rudy provoost' |publisher= investing.businessweek.com|date=|accessdate=2013-11-03}}</ref> He became Vice-President, Group Sales, Whirlpool Europe, Senior Officer and Member of the Chairman’s Council of Whirlpool Corporation in 1994 (based in Italy). In 1996, Rudy Provoost moved on to become Vice-President, Group Marketing, Europe, and a member of Whirlpool Corporation’s Brand Council. In early 1999, he was promoted to Vice-President, Whirlpool Brand Group, Europe.
===Philips=== In 2000, Provoost joined [[Philips|Royal Philips]] to lead the European Philips Consumer Electronics business (based in The Netherlands).
In 2004 he was appointed CEO of Philips Consumer Electronics, and in 2006 became a member of the Management Board of [[Philips|Royal Philips]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.philips.com.hk/sites/philipshk/About/company/Global/Management/GroupManagementCommittee/article-2603.page |title= R. Provoost |publisher= philips.com.hk |date= |accessdate= 2013-11-03 |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20150924072341/http://www.philips.com.hk/sites/philipshk/About/company/Global/Management/GroupManagementCommittee/article-2603.page |archivedate= 2015-09-24 |df= }}</ref> Under his tenure, the consumer electronics division was restructured <ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2007/may/24/insideit.guardianweeklytechnologysection |title= 'Philips is now a very different company' |publisher= guardian.co.uk |date=2007-05-24 |accessdate=2013-11-03 |location=London |first=Jack |last=Schofield}}</ref> with a focus on innovation.
In 2008, Provoost became CEO of the Philips Lighting division launching the “Simply Enhancing Life with Light” strategy to position the company as a leader in innovative and sustainable lighting solutions.<ref>{{cite news|url= https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-05-03/philips-lighting-head-provoost-leaves-to-lead-rexel-next-year.html|title= Philips Lighting Head Provoost Leaves to Lead Rexel Next Year|publisher= bloomberg.com |date=2011-05-03 |accessdate=2012-04-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/04/23/philips-twenty-20-year-led-lightbulb-prize-department-of-energy_n_1445780.html |title=Philips Introduces 20-Year LED Lightbulb That Won Top DOE 'L-Prize' |publisher= huffingtonpost.com |date= 2012-04-23|accessdate=2012-04-23 |first=Jocelyn |last=Richard}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/specials/packages/article/0,28804,1934027_1934003_1933947,00.html|title=The 50 Best Inventions of 2009 - The $10 Million Lightbulb|publisher= time.com |date= 2009-11-12|accessdate=2012-04-23}}</ref>
As Chairman of the Sustainability Board at [[Philips|Royal Philips]], Rudy Provoost was the executive sponsor of the global Ecovision5 program, which integrated a green and social innovation agenda across the Group’s lighting, healthcare and consumer lifestyle divisions and provided a roadmap for sustainability at Philips.
===Rexel=== Provoost joined [[Rexel]] in October 2011<ref>{{cite news|url= https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/05/03/philips-idUSLDE7420KT20110503/|title= Philips Lighting CEO Rudy Provoost latest top exec to leave|publisher= reuters.com |date=2011-05-03|accessdate=2011-05-03}}</ref> and became CEO and Chairman of the Management Board at the beginning of 2012 (based in France).<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.euroinvestor.com/news/2012/02/09/rexel-rudy-provoost-succeeds-jean-charles-pauze-as-rexels-chairman-of-the-management-board/11900954 |title=Rudy Provoost succeeds Jean-Charles Pauze as Rexel’s Chairman of the Management Board |publisher= euroinvestor.com |date=2012-09-02 |accessdate=2013-11-03}}</ref> Shortly after joining Rexel, he announced the “Energy in Motion” company plan.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://retrofitmagazine.com/rexel-named-to-fortunes-most-admired-companies-list/|title= Rexel Named to FORTUNE’s Most-admired Companies List|publisher= retrofitmagazine.com |date=|accessdate=2013-11-03}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= http://electricalmarketing.com/blog/rexel-unveils-roadmap-growth-through-2015|title= Rexel unveils roadmap for growth through 2015|publisher= electricalmarketing.com |date=2012-05-30|accessdate=2013-11-03}}</ref>
In May 2013, Rudy Provoost became Chairman of the Rexel Foundation for a better energy future,<ref>[http://www.rexelfoundation.com/ Rexel foundation]</ref> which was launched under the auspices of the [[Fondation de France]].
In May 2014, Rudy Provoost was named Chairman of the Board of Directors and CEO of [[Rexel]].<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.rexel.com/en/finance/press-releases/rudy-provoost-is-named-chairman-and-ceo-catherine-guillouard-is-named-deputy-ceo.php?id=196|title= Rudy Provoost is named Chairman and CEO - Catherine Guillouard is named Deputy CEO|publisher= rexel.com |date=2014-05-23|accessdate=2014-05-28}}</ref> At the end of June 2016, Rudy Provoost relinquished his positions of Chairman and CEO.<ref>Paris, June 24, 2016, Internal Announcement</ref>
== Directorships and publications ==
Provoost is the Founder and Managing Director of YquitY, a company delivering advisory, consultancy and business development, investment and management services.<ref>[http://www.yquity.com/ YQUITY BVBA]</ref>
He is currently a Member of the Supervisory Board and the Strategic Committee of Randstad,<ref>[http://www.randstad.com/ Randstad N.V.]</ref> as well as a Member of the Board of Directors of Elia.<ref>[http://www.elia.com/ RealNames - Elia]</ref> He is also a Member of the Board of Directors of the [[Vlerick Leuven Gent Management School|Vlerick Business School]].
He was a Member of the Board of Directors of the [[TCL Corporation]] (headquartered in China) between 2007 and 2009, and Chairman of the Board of Directors of LG.Philips LCD (later renamed [[LG Display]], headquartered in South Korea) between 2006 and 2008.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=8201779&ticker=PHG:AU|title=Business Week – Rudy provoost' |publisher= investing.businessweek.com|date=|accessdate=2013-11-03}}</ref> From 2008 until 2010, he was a Member of the Board of the [[EFQM|European Federation of Quality Management]] (EFQM). Rudy Provoost also served as President and Chairman of the Executive Board of [[DigitalEurope|DIGITALEUROPE]] (formerly called EICTA, the European Information & Communications Technology Industry Association).<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.digitaleurope.org/DocumentDownload.aspx?Command=Core_Download&EntryId=239 |title=Digital Europe|publisher= digitaleurope.org |date=2010-01-01 |accessdate=2013-11-03}}</ref>
Provoost is a contributing author to the book ''The balancing act of innovation'' <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thebalancingactofinnovation.com/ |title= The balancing act of innovation |publisher=thebalancingactofinnovation.com |date=2011-11-19 |accessdate=2013-11-03}}</ref> as well as the ''Knowledge@[[Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania|Wharton]]'' series.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://knowledge.wharton.upenn.edu/article.cfm?articleid=1905 |title=Philips Lighting CEO Rudy Provoost: Innovation Means Putting Consumers' Needs First |publisher= knowledge.wharton.upenn.edu |date=2008-02-20 |accessdate=2013-11-03}}</ref>
He is also author of ''Energy 3.0'', a book which discusses the digital transformation of the energy world. The book is published in English and French by Cherche Midi.<ref>[http://www.cherche-midi.com/theme/detail-Energy_3.0-9782749135069.html Energy 3.0: Transforming the world of energy for growth], Le Cherche Midi (ed.)</ref>

The '''School Enterprise Challenge''' is an international competition for schools to establish profitable student-led businesses.
It aims to develop young people’s business and soft skills to better prepare them for the world of work and to develop their capacities as socially responsible entrepreneurs. The income generated from these businesses moreover can provide a useful additional source of funds for less well-resourced schools in developing countries, or can be used to support social projects in the community by better resourced schools.
The competition since its launch in 2011 has benefited over 80,000 young people directly from over 90 countries and has been recognized internationally for its positive social impact, including as one of the [[World_Innovation_Summit_for_Education|WISE]] Awards 2014 finalists.

World Offshore Champion }} '''Stefano Casiraghi''' (8 September 1960 – 3 October 1990) was an [[Italians|Italian]] speedboat racer, [[socialite]], and businessman. He was the son of Giancarlo Casiraghi and Fernanda Biffi, and became the second husband of [[Caroline, Princess of Hanover|Princess Caroline of Monaco]]. He was famous for having set a speed record in speedboat racing and was at the time of his death in a racing accident, the world champion of [[offshore powerboat racing]]. ==Early life== The son of Giancarlo Casiraghi (d. 1998), a businessman and Fernanda (née Biffi), Stefano Casiraghi grew up in the Casiraghi family's estate, Villa Cigogne, in [[Fino Mornasco]].[http://stefanocasiraghi.chez.com/ ''Biographie de Stefano Casiraghi''.] He had two brothers, Marco and Daniele (died in 2016), and one sister, Rosalba. He also developed an early passion for the speedboat races on [[Lake Como]].Reed, J.D.; Joel Stratte-McClure and Logan Bentley. [http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20113334,00.html "Another Tragedy for Monaco"], ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'', 15 October 1990. Accessed 7 June 2010 He followed the course of his brothers by enrolling at [[Milan]]'s [[Bocconi University]]. However, his eagerness to work in business was stronger than his wish to have a degree, or his skills to obtain one,Fowler, Glenn. [https://www.nytimes.com/1990/10/04/obituaries/stefano-casiraghi-30-husband-of-caroline-of-monaco-is-killed.html Stefano Casiraghi, 30, Husband of Caroline of Monaco, is killed], ''The New York Times'', 4 October 1990. Accessed 7 June 2010. and he left the university after only two years of study, to begin to work for his father and his oldest brother, Marco. ==Business== He was involved in the real estate and retail export enterprises of the family business that his father had built up. His [[obituary]] in ''[[The New York Times]]'' described him as a [[financier]] and said, at his death, Casiraghi was Chairman of "Cogefar France" (a construction [[subsidiary]] of [[Fiat]]). The same source said he had a majority interest in Engeco, a Monaco-based [[construction]] company which he founded in 1984. At the time of his first child's birth, it was said that he was the director of the [[Christian Dior]] boutique in Monte Carlo. == Speedboat racing == A self-styled "throttle man,"''Private Lives'', published by Oxmoor House, 1991. {{ISBN|978-0-8487-1024-8}} Casiraghi participated in eighty [[Offshore powerboat racing|offshore]] races during his lifetime. Over a 20-year career, he won a dozen of those competitions and, at the time of his death, was the world champion of offshore speedboat racing, including the World Championship held off the coast of [[Atlantic City]] in 1989. Casiraghi had set the record (since broken) for 277 km/h on [[Lake Como]] in 1984. It is a very dangerous sport, but as Casiraghi once said, "There are more dangerous sports and I believe one should live life to the fullest." ==Marriage and family== On 29 December 1983 in [[Monaco]], he and Princess Caroline married in a civil ceremony in the Hall of Mirrors of the Monegasque Princely Palace. They were not able to have a Catholic ceremony because Caroline had been divorced from [[Philippe Junot]], and an annulment had not yet been obtained. However, as Caroline was over three months pregnant, the couple did not want to wait any longer.{{cn|date=October 2018}} Her father, [[Rainier III, Prince of Monaco|Prince Rainier III]] was by all accounts initially suspicious of his new son-in-law as were many others. The Italian papers called Casiraghi "Carolino" and portrayed him as a mere plaything for his wife.{{cn|date=October 2018}} The couple had three children: [[Andrea Casiraghi|Andrea]] (born 8 June 1984), [[Charlotte Casiraghi|Charlotte]] (born 3 August 1986), and [[Pierre Casiraghi|Pierre]] (born 5 September 1987). The children are, respectively, fourth, eighth and eleventh in the [[line of succession to the Monegasque throne]], after their twin cousins and their mother. Despite their parents' not having married in the Church as required for legitimacy under church (but not Monagasque) law, they were legitimised by [[Pope John Paul II]] in February 1993, eight months after their mother's marriage to Junot was [[annulled]] in June 1992.{{cite book |last1=Knightley |first1=Emma |title=Princely Monaco XXI: The House of Grimaldi in the 21st Century |isbn=9780359058945 |edition=Kindle }} ==Death== Casiraghi was killed in an offshore powerboat racing accident off the coast of [[Monaco]] near [[Cap Ferrat]] on 3 October 1990 while defending his world offshore title. He was 30 years old and had planned to retire after the race. Only weeks earlier, he had escaped death when his boat blew up off the coast of [[Guernsey]].Kurth, Peter. [http://www.peterkurth.com/Monaco1.htm "In the House of Grimaldi"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110927064324/http://www.peterkurth.com/Monaco1.htm |date=27 September 2011 }}, ''[[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]]''. There were three to four-foot wave conditions on the race course, which caused Casiraghi's 42-foot [[catamaran]], ''Pinot di Pinot'', to flip. Traveling at ca. 150 km/h, it did not have a full canopy, and experts who studied the accident have said that Casiraghi would most likely have survived the accident had the boat been equipped with such a canopy. As a result of his death, safety laws became more stringent; a [[safety harness]] and closed hull became compulsory, as was a twin hull design for boats. Races nowadays take place close to the harbor where waves are gentler, which is policed off for safety reasons as boats are no longer allowed to drive near the course. Of the tragedy, [[Anne Edwards]] wrote that Casiraghi and his copilot, Patrice Innocenti, had been "trying to make up for time they had lost earlier in the race when they had stopped to rescue a pilot whose vessel had caught fire."{{cite book|last1=Edwards|first1=Anne|title=The Grimaldis of Monaco|date=1993|publisher=HarperCollins|isbn=0006374697|page=17|edition=Paperback}} Patrice Innocenti, survived the accident. He was pulled from the water and taken to Monaco's Princess Grace Hospital. The funeral Mass was held in Monaco's Cathedral of St. Nicholas exactly eight years after Princess Grace's funeral in the same place.Tarraborelli, J. Randy :''Once Upon a Time: Behind the Fairy Tale of Princess Grace and Prince Rainier ''. Warner Books, 2004. {{ISBN|978-0-446-61380-4}} Stefano Casiraghi is buried in the Chapelle de la Paix in [[Monaco]], which is also the resting place of his wife's paternal grandfather, [[Pierre de Polignac|Prince Pierre of Monaco]]. ==Notes== ==External links== * [http://www.powerboatpix.co.uk/photo_151208.html Photograph of Stefano Casiraghi on the day he died] *{{YouTube|TcB34ED8xXI|The video of Casiraghi's fatal accident}} {{Caroline, Princess of Hanover}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Casiraghi, Stefano}} [[Category:1960 births]] [[Category:1990 deaths]] [[Category:People from the Province of Como]] [[Category:House of Grimaldi]] [[Category:Italian Roman Catholics]] [[Category:Italian businesspeople]] [[Category:Italian socialites]] [[Category:Italian motorboat racers]] [[Category:Motorboat racers killed while racing]] [[Category:Sport deaths in France]]

{{Dablink|For general information on private equity and hedge funds, see [[Private equity]] and [[hedge fund]].}} {{Dablink|For detailed information on private equity fund structures, see [[Private equity fund]] and [[private equity firm]].}} {{Globalize|date=September 2010}} [[File:Fund Structure.png|thumb|upright=1.3|Structure of a private equity or hedge fund, which shows the carried interest and [[management fee]] received by the fund's investment managers. The [[general partner]] is the financial entity used to control and manage the fund, while the [[limited partner]]s are the individual investors who receive their return as [[capital gain|capital interest]].<ref name=Fleischer>{{cite journal|last=Fleischer|first=Victor|title=Two and Twenty: Taxing Partnership Profits in Private Equity Funds|journal=New York University Law Review|date=2008|ssrn=892440|accessdate=}}</ref>]] [[Private equity]] funds and [[hedge fund]]s are private investment vehicles used to pool investment capital, usually for a small group of large institutional or wealthy individual investors. They are subject to favorable regulatory treatment in most jurisdictions from which they are managed, which allows them to engage in financial activities that are off-limits for more regulated companies. Both types of fund also take advantage of generally applicable rules in their jurisdictions to minimize the tax burden on their investors, as well as on the fund managers. As media coverage increases regarding the growing influence of hedge funds and private equity, these tax rules are increasingly under scrutiny by legislative bodies.<ref>Michael S. Knoll, ''Article: The Taxation of Private Equity Carried Interests: Estimating the Revenue Effects of taxing Profit Interests as Ordinary Income'', 50 WM. & MARY L. REV. 115, 117 (2008).</ref> Private equity and hedge funds choose their structure depending on the individual circumstances of the investors the fund is designed to attract.
==Basic structure: U.S. domestic fund== A private equity or hedge fund located in the [[United States]] will typically be structured as a [[limited partnership]], due to the lack of an entity-level tax on [[partnership]]s and other [[flow-through entity|flow-through entities]] under the [[Taxation in the United States|U.S. tax system]].<ref>See generally, subchapter K of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code, Title 26 of the U.S. Code.</ref> The limited partners will be the institutional and individual investors. The general partner will be an affiliate of the manager of the fund. Typically, the manager of the hedge fund is compensated with a fee based on 2% of the gross assets of the fund, and a profits interest entitling the manager (or, more typically, its affiliated general partner) to 20% of the fund's return (subject, in many cases, to minimum guaranteed returns for the limited partners).<ref name=Marples>{{cite news|last=Marples|first=Donald|title=Taxation of Hedge Fund and Private Equity Managers|url=https://www.fas.org/sgp/crs/misc/RS22689.pdf|accessdate=4 March 2014|newspaper=[[Congressional Research Service]]|date=2 January 2014}}</ref>
==Carried interest== {{See also|Carried interest}} Because the manager is compensated with a profits interest in the fund, the bulk of its income from the fund is taxed, not as compensation for services, but as a return on investment. Typically, when a partner receives a profits interest (commonly referred to as a "carried interest"), the partner is not taxed upon receipt, due to the difficulty of ascertaining the present value of an interest in future profits.<ref>See, e.g., Campbell v. United States (8th Cir. 1981). This approach was adopted as a general administrative rule by the IRS in a notice in 1993, and again in proposed regulations in 2005.</ref> Instead, the partner is taxed as the partnership earns income. In the case of a hedge fund, this means that the partner defers taxation on the income that the hedge fund earns, which is typically ordinary income (or possibly short-term capital gains), due to the nature of the investments most hedge funds make. Private equity funds, however, typically invest on a longer horizon, with the result that income earned by the funds is long-term capital gain, taxable to individuals at a maximum 20% rate. Because the 20% profits share typically is the bulk of the manager’s compensation, and because this compensation can reach, in the case of the most successful funds, enormous figures, concern has been raised, both in Congress and in the media, that managers are taking advantage of tax loopholes to receive what is effectively a salary without paying the ordinary 39.6% marginal income tax rates that an average person would have to pay on such income.<ref name=Marples/> To address this concern, Congressman [[Sander M. Levin]] introduced {{USBill|110|H.R.|2834}}, which would eliminate the ability of persons performing investment adviser or similar services to partnerships to receive capital gains tax treatment on their income. However, the Treasury Department has suggested, both in testimony before the Senate Finance Committee<ref>[http://finance.senate.gov/hearings/testimony/2007test/071107testes.pdf Microsoft Word - 07.11.07 TESTIMONY Solomon on Carried Interest.doc] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070726015950/http://finance.senate.gov/hearings/testimony/2007test/071107testes.pdf |date=July 26, 2007 }}</ref> and in public speaking engagements,<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web|last=Donmoyer |first=Ryan J. |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=alm0Crt0eICY |title=News |publisher=Bloomberg.com |date=2007-06-27 |accessdate=2014-07-30}}</ref> that altering the tax treatment of a single industry raises tax policy concerns, and that changing the way partnerships in general are taxed is something that should only be done after careful consideration of the potential impact.
Congressman [[Charles B. Rangel]] included a revised version of H.R. 2834 as part of the "Mother of All Tax Reform" and the 2007 House extenders package. A line item on taxing carried interest at ordinary income rates was included in the Obama Administration's 2008 Budget Blueprint.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.whitehouse.gov/omb/asset.aspx?AssetId=793 |archive-url=http://webarchive.loc.gov/all/20090227032520/http://www.whitehouse.gov/omb/assets/fy2010_new_era/A_New_Era_of_Responsibility2.pdf |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2009-02-27 |title=See page 122 of the White House version of "A New Era of Responsibility - Renewing America’s Promise" |date= |accessdate=2014-07-30 }}</ref> On April 2, 2009, Congressman Levin introduced a new and substantially revised version of the carried interest legislation as {{USBill|111|H.R.|1935}}. On May 28, 2010, the House approved carried interest legislation as part of amendments to the Senate-passed version of {{USBill|111|H.R.|4213}}.<ref name=hr4016>{{cite web|title=H.R. 4016: Carried Interest Fairness Act of 2012|publisher=Democrats of the [[United States House Committee on Ways and Means]]|url=http://democrats.waysandmeans.house.gov/bill/hr-4016-carried-interest-fairness-act-2012|accessdate=17 April 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140418234019/http://democrats.waysandmeans.house.gov/bill/hr-4016-carried-interest-fairness-act-2012|archivedate=18 April 2014|df=}}</ref> On February 14, 2012, Congressman Levin introduced {{USBill|112|H.R.|4016}}.<ref name=hr4016/>
==Publicly traded partnerships== In mid-2007, the Blackstone group, a major private equity fund, went public. Ordinarily, a publicly traded partnership is taxed as a corporation.<ref>26 U.S.C. 7704(a) (2007)</ref> There is, however, an exception for publicly traded partnerships earning only “passive-type” income, such as interest and dividends.<ref>26 U.S.C. 7704(c) (2007)</ref> Although the investments made by a private equity fund are actively managed, Blackstone took the position that the investments they engaged in fell squarely within literal language of this exception to the usual treatment for publicly traded partnerships.<ref>{{cite web|last=Donmoyer |first=Ryan J. |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=aLT1S7eAbIQg |title=News |publisher=Bloomberg.com |date=2007-03-29 |accessdate=2014-07-30}}</ref> To address what they viewed as a loophole in the law, Senators Baucus and Grassley introduced S. 1624, which would remove the ability for publicly traded partnerships performing asset-management and related services to avoid being taxed as corporations.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://frwebgate.access.gpo.gov/cgi-bin/getdoc.cgi?dbname=110_cong_bills&docid=f:s1624is.txt.pdf |title=FDsys - Browse Congressional Bills |publisher=Frwebgate.access.gpo.gov |date= |accessdate=2014-07-30}}</ref> The result of this bill would be to change the tax treatment of private equity and hedge funds from a single level of taxation at a 15% rate (or 35% in the case of most hedge funds) to a corporate-level tax of 35%, plus a 15% tax on dividends when distributed. While acknowledging that there are concerns with the current treatment of publicly traded partnerships, Treasury Secretary Paulson has declined to endorse the treatment that would be provided under S. 1624.<ref name=autogenerated1 />
The House extenders package included a carried interest provision that would apply to publicly traded partnerships beginning in tax years after 31 December 2009.
Various private equity and hedge fund managers followed Fortress, the first fund manager to go public as a PTP. The funds include Oaktree, [[Blackstone Group]], [[Och-Ziff]], [[Kohlberg Kravis Roberts|KKR]], [[Apollo Global Management]], and [[Carlyle Group]].
=="Blocker" corporations== {{Main|Blocker corporation}} Although a partnership structure is advantageous for most investors due to the elimination of an entity-level tax, it is not the desired form for all investors. In particular, foreign investors and domestic tax-exempt organizations both have reasons to prefer to interpose a corporation in the private equity or hedge fund structure.<ref name=Marples/>
Foreign investors are generally not required to file tax returns unless they have “effectively connected income,” derived from the active conduct of a U.S. trade or business.<ref>26 U.S.C. 871 & 881 (2007)</ref> Passive investment in a corporation does not give rise to a U.S. trade or business. However, active investment management of the type performed by private equity funds or hedge funds typically does.<ref>26 U.S.C. 864 (2007) and regulations thereunder</ref> Because partners in a partnership are treated as engaged in whatever business the partnership itself is engaged in, this means that if a foreign investor invests in a hedge fund or private equity fund, it will generally be forced to file a U.S. tax return. To avoid this requirement, a foreign investor will often invest through a [[blocker corporation]] (usually located in the Cayman Islands or another offshore jurisdiction). The corporation itself will be required to file U.S. tax returns, and will pay taxes at the normal U.S. corporate tax rate, but the foreign investor will receive only dividends or capital gains from the blocker, and will therefore not be required to file a U.S. return. As an alternative to the “blocker” structure, hedge funds seeking to attract foreign investors can also structure as partnerships, but simply restrict themselves to activities that are not treated as a U.S. trade or business. For example, U.S. tax law provides that trading in securities for the taxpayer’s own account will not constitute a U.S. trade or business.<ref>26 U.S.C. 864(b) (2007)</ref> Thus foreign hedge funds formed as corporations do not generally pay corporate income tax.<ref>Humphreys T, Man A. (2006). [http://www.executiveview.com/knowledge_centre.php?id=1376 Introduction to US Tax Aspects of Hedge Fund Formation]{{Dead link|date=June 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}. Morrison & Foerster LLP.</ref>
Domestic tax-exempt entities face similar concerns when investing in funds structured as partnerships. While tax-exempt on income related to their tax-exempt purpose, tax exempt entities are required to file tax returns and pay income tax on “unrelated business taxable income,” commonly referred to as UBTI. Because the activities of an entity structured as a partnership flow through to its investors, if the partnership receives income that would be UBTI in the hands of the tax-exempt investor, the investor is forced to file an income-tax return and pay unrelated business income tax. To avoid this requirement, tax exempt entities use offshore blocker corporations in much the same way foreign investors do.<ref name=Marples/> To date, no bill has been introduced to change this treatment, although concerns over the tax gap have led to increased scrutiny of business structures involving offshore corporations in general. For example, in May 2007, the Senate Finance Committee held a hearing about offshore structures used for tax evasion.<ref>[http://finance.senate.gov/sitepages/hearing050307.htm Finance] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070627180810/http://finance.senate.gov/sitepages/hearing050307.htm |date=June 27, 2007 }}</ref>

The '''Uniform Domain-Name Dispute-Resolution Policy''' ('''UDRP''') is a process established by the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers ([[ICANN]]) for the resolution of disputes regarding the registration of internet [[domain names]]. The UDRP currently applies to all [[Generic top-level domain|generic top level domains]] ([[.com]], [[.net]], [[.org]], etc...),<ref>[http://www.icann.org/en/udrp/ ICANN – Domain Name Dispute Resolution Policies]</ref> some [[country code top-level domains]], and some older top level domains in specific circumstances.
==Historical background== When ICANN was first set up, one of the core tasks assigned to it was "The Trademark Dilemma",<ref>See US Government White Paper http://www.icann.org/en/about/agreements/white-paper</ref> the use of trade marks as domain names without the trademark owner's consent. By the late 1990s, such use was identified as problematic and likely to lead to consumers being misled. In the United Kingdom, the [[Court of Appeal of England and Wales|Court of Appeal]] described such domain names as "an instrument of fraud".<ref>British Telecommunications plc v One in a Million Ltd [1999] 1 WLR 903, [[Aldous LJ]] at 920.</ref>
One of ICANN's first steps was to commission the United Nations [[World Intellectual Property Organization]] (WIPO) to produce a report on the conflict between trademarks and domain names. Published on 30 April 1999, the WIPO Report<ref>The Management of Internet Names and Addresses: Intellectual Property Issues, 30 April 1999. http://www.wipo.int/export/sites/www/amc/en/docs/report-final1.pdf</ref> recommended the establishment of a "mandatory administrative procedure concerning abusive registrations", which would allow for a "neutral venue in the context of disputes that are often international in nature." The procedure was not intended to deal with cases with competing rights, nor would it exclude the jurisdiction of the courts. It would, however, be mandatory in the sense that "each domain name application would, in the domain name agreement, be required to submit to the procedure if a claim was initiated against it by a third party<ref>See WIPO Mandatory Uniform UDRP Administrative Dispute Procedure. http://www.wipo.int/amc/en/processes/process1/report/finalreport.html#IV</ref>
The WIPO Report sets out the now familiar three stage test of the UDRP.
Following adoption by ICANN, the UDRP was launched on 1 December 1999, and the first case determined under it by WIPO was ''World Wrestling Federation Entertainment, Inc v. Michael Bosman'', involving the domain name worldwrestlingfederation.com<ref>[http://www.wipo.int/amc/en/domains/decisions/html/1999/d1999-0001.html WIPO Domain Name Decision: D1999-0001]. Wipo.int. Retrieved on 2014-04-28.</ref>
Providers of the UDRP are:
* [http://www.adndrc.org/mten/index.php The Asian Domain Name Dispute Resolution Centre (ADNDRC)] * [http://domains.adrforum.com/ National Arbitration Forum (NAF)] * [[World Intellectual Property Organization]] (WIPO) * [http://www.adr.eu/index.php Czech Arbitration Court, Arbitration Center for Internet Disputes] * [http://acdr.aipmas.org/default.aspx The Arab Center for Dispute Resolution (ACDR)]
===How it is made mandatory=== When a registrant chooses a domain name, the registrant must "represent and warrant", among other things, that registering the name "will not infringe upon or otherwise violate the rights of any third party", and agree to participate in an [[arbitration]]-like proceeding should any third party assert such a claim.{{cn|date=April 2016}}
==Process== A complainant in a UDRP proceeding must establish three elements to succeed:
* The domain name is identical or confusingly similar to a [[trademark]] or [[service mark]] in which the complainant has rights; * The registrant does not have any rights or legitimate interests in the domain name; and * The domain name has been registered and the domain name is being used in "[[bad faith]]".
In a UDRP proceeding, a panel will consider several non-exclusive factors to assess bad faith, such as:
* Whether the registrant registered the domain name primarily for the purpose of selling, renting, or otherwise transferring the domain name registration to the complainant who is the owner of the trademark or service mark; * Whether the registrant registered the domain name to prevent the owner of the trademark or service mark from reflecting the mark in a corresponding domain name, if the domain name owner has engaged in a pattern of such conduct; and * Whether the registrant registered the domain name primarily for the purpose of disrupting the business of a competitor; or * Whether by using the domain name, the registrant has intentionally attempted to attract, for commercial gain, internet users to the registrant's website, by creating a likelihood of confusion with the complainant's mark.
The goal of the UDRP is to create a streamlined process for resolving such disputes. It was envisioned that this process would be quicker and less expensive than a standard legal challenge. The costs to hire a UDRP provider to handle a complaint often start around [[United States dollar|US$]]1,000 to $2,000.<ref>{{Citation | title = InterNIC | FAQs on the UDRP | url = http://www.internic.net/faqs/udrp.html | accessdate = 2009-10-09 }}</ref>
If a party loses a UDRP proceeding, in many jurisdictions it may still bring a lawsuit against the domain name registrant under local law. For example, the administrative panel's UDRP decision can be challenged and overturned in a U.S. court of law by means of e.g. the [[Anticybersquatting Consumer Protection Act]]. If a domain name registrant loses a UDRP proceeding, it must file a lawsuit against the trademark holder within ten days to prevent ICANN from transferring the domain name.<ref>[http://www.cybersquatting.com An Informational Website About Cybersquatting Law]</ref>
==Examples== The UDRP process has already been used in a number of well-known cases, such as [http://www.wipo.int/amc/en/domains/decisions/html/2000/d2000-0847.html ''Madonna Ciccone, p/k/a Madonna v. Dan Parisi and "Madonna.com"'']. In this case, the arbitration panel found against the defendant registrant based on all three of the above factors and ordered the domain name turned over to Madonna.
Often there is contention over similar but not identical domain names, in which the offended party files a court action claiming [[trademark]] or [[copyright infringement]]. For example, actor [[Robert De Niro]] has claimed ownership of all domain names incorporating the text "[[Tribeca]]" for domain names with any content related to film festivals. In particular, he has a dispute with the owner of the website http://tribeca.net.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.cinematical.com/2007/01/02/robert-de-niro-raging-bully/ | title = Robert De Niro: Raging Bully? | date = 2 January 2007 | last = Davis | first = Erik | website = Cinematical}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nypost.com/seven/12312006/gossip/pagesix/pagesix.htm |title=I am Tribeca, De Niro claims |date=31 December 2006 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070403050416/http://www.nypost.com/seven/12312006/gossip/pagesix/pagesix.htm |archivedate=April 3, 2007 }}</ref>
==Domain name disputes under new gTLDs== In 2012, ICANN launched a process to create [[.events|new generic top-level domains]]. Over 1,900 applications were made. As part of the expansion of the domain name system, ICANN introduced a number of new brand protection mechanisms. Opinions differ as to whether or not these new processes will be effective. Industry commentators predict that the UDRP will continue to be used, and that there will be a "substantial increase in cybersquatting".<ref>Bloomberg BNA, Cyberlaw Predictions 2013, http://www.bna.com/cyberlaw-predictions-2013-b17179871639/</ref> Evidence from previous expansions of the namespace, however, indicates the continued dominance of .com both in size and as the first-choice domain for cybersquatting (based on number of disputes).<ref>"Previous expansions of the namespace have failed to capture the public imagination or to pose a competitive threat to the gorilla in the market, .com. According to WIPO, of 42,000 UDRP filings to date, 80% were for .com domains, and of the new gTLDs, only .info has attracted any volume of UDRP disputes (3% of cases filed)." http://www.emilytaylor.eu/2013/01/online-brand-protection-what-to-expect.html#.UQqKlL9Wx8E</ref>

'''Valdemar Josef Glückstadt''' (25 February 1868 in [[Oslo|Christiania]] - 11 November 1942) was a Danish businessman and Consul-General.
He was the son of prominent banker [[Isak Glückstadt]] og Juliette Sophie Raffel, and belonged to a prominent Jewish family from Denmark. His brother was [[Emil Glückstadt]].
He was a Knight of the [[Order of the Dannebrog]], and the Consul-General of Italy to Denmark.
He was married to Julie Emilie [[:da:Rée|Rée]] (born 1875, died 1952), daughter of [[Edvard Rée]]. Their daughter Ella Glückstadt (b. 1899) was married in 1920 to Count Erik [[Moltke]] of Nør (died 1922) og secondly to [[Thorleif Paus]].
